title: Article 3 - Data Sharing
paragraphs: While using the app, your privacy is now enhanced beyond what we have been able to offer on thewww.startpage.comwebsite, in that the third-party websites you visit within the app are not tracked, whether in a Regular or Private tab. Additionally, within the app, we offer the option to utilize Anonymous View for browsing, allowing you to maintain anonymity to the third-party websites you visit, if desired.Diagnostic reportsIf the Startpage Private Browser app crashes or freezes, a report is sent to us to assist us in identifying and resolving the issue. title: Article 5 - User Rights
paragraphs: ContentsWe don't collect any "personal data"How we define "personal data"We don't record your search queriesHow we have implemented truly anonymous analyticsHow we keep Startpage free without using "personal data"What happens to your data beyond Startpage searchHow we respond to governmental requests for dataWe will never comply with any voluntary surveillance programStartpage complies with the GDPRIn the EU you have a "right to be forgotten"Dutch Data Protection AuthorityThe Startpage Private Browser appOur company and contact informationWe don't collect any "personal data"If information isnt collected, it cant be stolen, demanded, leaked or abused. We consider any information about you or your behavior that can be traced back to you as personal data.Information we dont collectSo lets be perfectly clear:We dont record your IP addressThe only exception is for automated search requests (robots) that rapidly submit more queries to our servers than any normal human would. Once you click on a YouTube video result, you will be sent towww.youtube.com, and be subject to theGoogle Privacy Policy.How we respond to governmental requests for dataThey cant request what we dont have. Any request will have to come from Dutch judicial authorities. But were not likely to receive requests by governments to hand over user data  simply because we dont have any.We will never comply with any voluntary surveillance programFortunately, we are based in the EU, where we have strong laws that protect your right to privacy. This can also help you implement important privacy principles, such as data minimization, storage limitation, privacy by design and privacy by default.In the EU you have a "right to be forgotten"Citizens in the EU have the right to request the deletion of search results that disclose their personal data when those results are inaccurate or no longer relevant. title: Article 6 - Security
paragraphs: Not because you have something to hide, but because you have a lot to protect!We blazed the trail in 2006, and protecting your privacy is now more important than ever.Protecting your privacy is all about having control over your data. At Startpage, we help you control and protect whats yours.When it comes to privacy, it's not just our policy. We blazed the trail in 2006, and protecting your privacy is now more important than ever. Protecting your privacy is all about having control over your data. At Startpage, we help you control and protect whats yours. Protecting your privacy is all about having control over your data. At Startpage, we help you control and protect whats yours. Protecting your personal data is the best way to safeguard your online privacy.How we define "personal data"Our definition of personal data is based on the privacy laws and regulations of the EU, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). These are widely regarded as the strongest privacy protections in the world. We dont log your searches.To prevent abuse such as robotic high-volume querying, we anonymously determine the frequency of popular search keywords as a part of our anti-abuse measures, while protecting your privacy.How we have implemented truly anonymous analyticsWe do measure overall traffic numbers and some other  strictly anonymous  statistics. Once you click on a search result, you leave our site and our privacy protection. European governments cant legally force service providers like Startpage to implement a blanket spying program.Startpage complies with the GDPRWe are located in the EU, and we fully comply with applicable privacy laws and regulations of the EU, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). These are widely regarded as the strongest privacy protections in the world.Looking for a quick win to improve your own GDPR compliance? Find out how we have implemented this righthere.Dutch Data Protection AuthorityWe are always here to help. If you have any feedback or complaint about our services in general, or more specifically about how your privacy is protected when you use our services, please let us know via the contact details below. In accordance with EU privacy laws and regulations, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the national supervisory authority responsible for the protection of personal data if you think we have unlawfully processed your personal data. For the Netherlands, this supervisory authority is the Dutch Data Protection Authority, which you can contacthere.The Startpage Private Browser appThe Startpage Private Browser app for iOS and Android uses Startpage as its default search engine. title: Article 7 - Cookies
paragraphs: When our software detects potential abuse, we register and block the offending IP address in order to keep our service safe and free.We dont serve any tracking or identifying cookiesThis is about "good" and "bad" cookies. Cookies are small pieces of data that are sent to your hard drive by websites you visit. "Bad" cookies have unique elements that can track all kinds of personal information. These stats may include the number of times our service is accessed by a certain operating system, a type of browser, a language, etc., but we dont know anything about individual users.How we keep Startpage free without using "personal data"Most online advertising today is personalized, meaning that online advertising services track what you do online and profile you in order to serve tailored ads. We utilize a service called Sentry to store these reports.Product analyticsAnonymized analytics within the Startpage Private Browser app alert us when there are major product issues or outages, and help inform what enhancements may be needed to improve the experience. title: Article 10 - Contact Information

title: Article 11 - General
paragraphs: Our Privacy PolicyWe created Startpage to help you search and browse the internet privately. Our Privacy PolicyWe created Startpage to help you search and browse the internet privately. Our Privacy PolicyWe created Startpage to help you search and browse the internet privately. We created Startpage to help you search and browse the internet privately. We created Startpage to help you search and browse the internet privately. We created Startpage to help you search and browse the internet privately. When it comes to privacy, it's not just our policy. When it comes to privacy, it's not just our policy. We dont serve any of those. Startpage uses just one "good" cookie called "preferences" in order to remember the search preferences you choose. Its completely anonymous and expires after not visiting Startpage for 90 days.We don't record your search queriesWhen you search, your query is automatically stripped of unnecessary metadata including your IP address and other identifying information.We send the anonymized search query to our search and content providers and returnthe search results to you. We dont do that at Startpage. No profiling!Our search result pages may include a small number of clearly labeled "sponsored links," which generate revenue and cover our operational costs. Those links are retrieved from platforms such as Google AdSense. In order to enable the prevention of click fraud, some non-identifying system information is shared, but because we never share personal information or information that could uniquely identify you, the ads we display are not connected to any individual user.Its a myth that search engines need to profile you in order to earn decent money. Startpage serves strictly non-personalized ads. Sure, our ads make only a fraction of what other search engine ads make, but they pay all our bills.What happens to your data beyond Startpage searchStartpage returns results from various sources. This is true for sponsored links, search results and other external links. Unless ... you use our proprietary feature"Anonymous View"  shown next to the search results. This is a great privacy tool that allows you to continue to browse in full privacy.For example, many video results are retrieved from YouTube API Services. Well only comply if were legally obliged to do so. Setting Startpage as the default search engine on all your organizations IT equipment will help you minimize the amount of personal data that is processed by or for your organization. Search queries are not collected, stored, or shared with third parties. Your browsing history is only available to you, on your own device. Your search and browsing history are not stored in our server logs. This report may include technical details about the device and what triggered the problem, but does not include personally identifying information (like your IP address). The analytics do not include personally identifying information (like IP address), or information about your searches or browsing activity. Example anonymized analytics are total number of installs, volumes of usage, errors, downtime, or whether new features are being used.Product event analyticsare powered by a service called Amplitude, and when this service is being used, data is proxied through servers managed by Startpage to ensure that personally identifying data is stripped before making its way to the service. We dont do that at Startpage. No profiling!Our search result pages may include a small number of clearly labeled "sponsored links," which generate revenue and cover our operational costs. In order to enable the prevention of click fraud, some non-identifying system information is shared, but because we never share personal information or information that could uniquely identify you, the ads we display are not connected to any individual user.Its a myth that search engines need to profile you in order to earn decent money. Startpage serves strictly non-personalized ads. Sure, our ads make only a fraction of what other search engine ads make, but they pay all our bills.What happens to your data beyond Startpage searchStartpage returns results from various sources. Example anonymized analytics are total number of installs, volumes of usage, errors, downtime, or whether new features are being used.Product event analyticsare powered by a service called Amplitude, and when this service is being used, data is proxied through servers managed by Startpage to ensure that personally identifying data is stripped before making its way to the service.
